name: Dirty Rice with Shrimp
description: This Louisiana-style dirty rice with shrimp is a classic Southern dish. With classic Cajun spices, a flavorful base of onions, celery, and bell pepper, and plenty of protein from the shrimp, this dish is a complete meal in one pot.
keywords: dirty rice, cajun, shrimp, rice, rice dish, Louisiana, Southern, one pot

recipeInstructions.text: In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the onion, celery, bell pepper, and garlic. Saut√© until the vegetables are softened, about 4 minutes.
Add the Cajun seasoning, oregano, thyme, cayenne, smoked paprika, black pepper, white pepper, and garlic powder. Stir to combine.
Add the rice, chicken broth, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Add the shrimp. Cover and cook until the shrimp are cooked through and the rice is tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the parsley and fluff the rice with a fork. Serve hot.
